headline: Salty Chick-fil-A manager makes list of forbidden words
content:
Submit 



		Thanks for contacting us. We've received your submission.	A Chick-fil-A manager is so irritated at his staff’s use of slang that he compiled a list of terms the employees are forbidden to use. The missive has gone viral in social media.Among the banned words that ruffled his feathers:“Chill (unless we are talking about something that is chilled),” “Fool,” “Cuz (this goes for cousin and because), “Bruh,” “Bae” and “Guh.”Even the word “Ebola” is off-limits.“Stop accusing people of having ebola,” Eric, whose last name is unknown, reportedly warned the staff in the letter, a copy of which was posted to Reddit on Nov. 6.“You will speak properly when you walk through these doors,” he wrote. “You are a professional so speak professionally.”He also warned them not to deface the list by crossing out any of the words.“Scratch it out + you lose your employee meals!” he added by hand to the typed document.One of the workers posted a copy of the note on Reddit, writing: “I work at Chick-fil-a and Eric, our manager, is tired of our s***.”The post has gotten more than 1,300 comments.Calls to Chick-fil-A were not immediately returned.Share Selection
